intro: Pouzolzia rothiana, commonly known as the silverleaf pouzolzia, is a perennial shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, dense hairs that help reduce water loss in hot, dry climates. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round berries that are typically green when mature. Pouzolzia rothiana is often found growing on rocky soils and in disturbed habitats, demonstrating a high degree of adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological resilience make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
